arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَهَبْ لِى مُلْكًۭا لَّا يَنۢبَغِى لِأَحَدٍۢ مِّنۢ بَعْدِىٓ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord!	Forgive	me	and	bestow	upon	me	a	kingdom,	which	shall	not	befit	anyone	after	
me;	indeed	only	You	are	the	Great	Bestower.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Àrz	ki	aey	mere	Rab!	Mujhe	bakhsh	de	aur	mujhe	aisi	salṭanat	'aṭā	kar	ke	mere	b'ad	kisi	ko	lāiq	
na	ho	be-shak	to	hi	hai	badi	dain	wālā.

arabicText: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ ٱلرِّيحَ تَجْرِى بِأَمْرِهِۦ رُخَآءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ
englishTranslationText: We	therefore	gave	the	wind	under	his	control,	moving	steadily	by	his	command	wherever	he	wished.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Ham	ne	hawā	us	ke	bas	meiñ	kar	di	ke	us	ke	ḥukm	se	narm	narm	chalti	jahāñ	woh	chāhtā.

englishTranslationText: And	made	the	demons	subservient	to	him,	all	builders	and	divers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	dew	bas	meiñ	kar	diye	har	m'emār	aur	ghoṭa	khor.

englishTranslationText: And	other	demons	bound	in	chains.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	dosre	aur	bediyoñ	meiñ	jakde	huye.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا عَطَآؤُنَا فَٱمْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“This	is	Our	bestowal	-	you	may	therefore	bestow	favours	or	withhold	them	–	you	will	not	be	
questioned.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	Hamāri	'aṭā	hai	ab	tu	chāhe	to	eḥsān	kar	yā	rok	rakh	tujh	par	kuch	ḥisāb	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَـَٔابٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	for	him	in	Our	presence	are,	surely,	proximity	and	an	excellent	abode.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	us	ke	liye	hamāri	bārgāh	meiñ	zaroor	qurb	aur	achchhā	thikānā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَآ أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَسَّنِىَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ بِنُصْبٍۢ وَعَذَابٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	Our	bondman	Ayyub	(Job);	when	he	cried	out	*	to	his	Lord,	“The	devil	has	struck	
me	with	hardship	and	pain.”	(After	seven	years	of	patience.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	Hamāre	bande	Ayyub	ko	jab	us	ne	apne	Rab	ko	pukārā	ke	mujhe	shaiṭān	ne	taklif	aur	‘iƶā	lagā	
di.

arabicText: ٱرْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ ۖ هَـٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌۢ بَارِدٌۭ وَشَرَابٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
We	said	to	him,	“Strike	the	earth	with	your	foot;	this	cool	spring	is	for	bathing	and	drinking.”	(A	
spring	of	gushed	forth	when	he	struck	the	earth	–	this	was	a	miracle.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	ne	farmāyā	zameen	par	apnā	pāoñ	mār	ye	hai	thandā	chashma	nahāne	aur	pine	ko.

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ أَهْلَهُۥ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	bestowed	his	household	to	him	
and	one	more	similar	to	it	–	as	a	mercy	
from	Us,	and	as	a	remembrance	for	the	
people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	usey	us	ke	ghar	wāle	aur	un	ke	
barābar	aur	áṭā	farmā	diye	apni	raḥmat	
karne	aur	'aql	mandoñ	ki	nasiḥat	ko.

arabicText: وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًۭا فَٱضْرِب بِّهِۦ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ ۗ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَـٰهُ صَابِرًۭا ۚ نِّعْمَ ٱلْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	said,	“Take	a	broom	in	your	hand	
and	strike	her	with	it,	and	do	not	break	
your	vow”;	We	indeed	found	him	patiently	
enduring;	what	an	excellent	bondman!	He	
is	indeed	most	inclined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	farmāyā	ke	apne	hath	meiñ	aik	jhādo	le	
kar	us	se	mār	de	aur	qasam	na	tod	be-shak	
ham	ne	usey	sābir	pāyā	kyā		achchhā	banda	
be-shak	woh	bahut	ruju'	lāne	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ عِبَـٰدَنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُو۟لِى ٱلْأَيْدِى وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	Our	bondmen	Ibrahim,	and	
Ishaq,	and	Yaqub	–	the	men	of	power	and	
knowledge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	Hamāre	bandoñ	Ibrāhim	aur	
Isḥāq	aur	Y'aqūb	qurdrat	aur	'Ilm	wāloñ	ko.

englishTranslationText:
We	indeed	gave	them	distinction	with	a	
genuine	affair	–	the	remembrance	of	the	
(everlasting)	abode.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	unheñ	aik	khari	bāt	se	
imtiyāz	bakhshā	ke	woh	us	ghar	ki	yād	hai.

englishTranslationText:
And	in	Our	sight,	they	are	indeed	the	
chosen	ones,	the	beloved.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	woh	hamāre	nazdeek	chune	
huye	pasan-deedah	haiñ.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ إِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَٱلْيَسَعَ وَذَا ٱلْكِفْلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَخْيَارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	Ismail	and	Yasa’a	(Elisha)	
and	Zul-Kifl;	and	they	are	all	excellent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	Ismā'il	aur	Yas'a	aur	Zulkifl	ko	
aur	sab	achchhe	haiñ.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا ذِكْرٌۭ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَـَٔابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	an	advice;	and	indeed	for	the	pious	
is	an	excellent	abode.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	nasiḥat	hai	aur	be-shak	parhez-gāroñ	kā	
thikānā	bhalā.

englishTranslationText:
Everlasting	Gardens	-	all	its	gates	are	open	
for	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Basne	ke	bāgh	un	ke	liye	sab	darwāze	khule	
huye.

arabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَـٰكِهَةٍۢ كَثِيرَةٍۢ وَشَرَابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Reclining	on	pillows,	in	it	they	ask	for	
fruits	and	drinks	in	plenty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	takiya	lagāye	un	meiñ	bahut	se	
mewe	aur	sharāb	māñgte	haiñ.
